case_title: SULTAN KHAN AND ANOTHER vs DAUD ALI KHAN ETC.

accussed_details.name: Sultan Khan
allegation: Failure to pay rent for suit land under tenancy

complaint_summary: The petitioner objected to the decree passed by the Assistant Collector 1st Grade for unpaid rent and claimed that dues were already cleared and respondents failed to fulfill their obligations.
investigation_summary: Lower courts found ample evidence proving the landlord-tenant relationship and failure of the petitioner to pay rent. The Assistant Collector passed decrees for produce of Rs. 3,382.25 and Rs. 3,646.89 for two separate land parcels.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the revision petition, upholding the findings of the lower courts that the petitioner failed to prove his claims. The decree for produce was justified, and no compensation for improvement or disturbance was required as ejectment was kept in abeyance.
punishment: Decree for produce of Rs. 3,382.25 and Rs. 3,646.89 upheld.
legal_arguments: Petitioner claimed dues were cleared and respondents failed obligations.
Respondents provided evidence of unpaid rent and landlord-tenant relationship.
Petitioner failed to prove claims under M.L.R. 115.
key_issues: Failure to pay rent by tenant

legal_terms.Decree for produce: A court order requiring payment based on agricultural yield or rent.

words_and_phrases.Ejectment: Legal removal of a tenant from property.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around a landlord-tenant dispute where the petitioner failed to pay rent for agricultural land. Lower courts upheld the decrees for produce, rejecting claims of cleared dues and obligations under M.L.R. 115. Compensation for improvement was deemed unnecessary as ejectment was not decreed.
